alert.note: Alert for Imperial (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 15 at 5:46PM PDT until October 15 at 9:45PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Imperial County in southeastern California... * Until 945 PM PDT. * At 546 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms had produced heavy rain in New River drainage basin. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain had fallen over Mexico draining north. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Calexico and Seeley. The New River USGS stream gage located near the International Boundary has risen several feet and continues to rise. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
